alert.note: Alert for Grant (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 4:44PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Cherry, northeastern Grant and northern Hooker Counties through 515 PM CDT/415 PM MDT/... At 442 PM CDT/342 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 23 miles south of Medicine Lake to 18 miles northwest of Mullen to 8 miles east of Whitman. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Marsh Flat, Speckel Meir Lake, Round Lake, Hire, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Sevenmile Hill, Hecla, Kelso and Weir. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 161 and 190. Highway 97 between mile markers 62 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
